website_summaries.verdict: This simple yet feature-rich model offers basically everything that the average home sewist could want.
pros: Features 60 built-in stitches, which you can adjust the length and width of via the LCD screen
Adjustable sewing speed lets you take things at your own pace
Oversize table is great for quilting or larger projects
Comes with a wide range of useful accessories
cons: Some people report tension issues but seems to only affect a small percentage of users

website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight computerized machine for the novice who is ready for more. Has quilting capabilities and a wide stitch selection.
pros: Easy threading and bobbin winding prevent a lot of sewing stress
Feeds smooth and creates even stitches
Extra features like adjustable top speed, drop feed, and a host of accessories
cons: Can be difficult to adjust tension

customer_reviews.title: I hate it and just returned mine
customer_reviews.text: I hate it and just returned mine after a week... I bought it to sew knit fabric for apparel. It destroys knit fabric. 3 different presser feet including walking foot and ball point needles and it still gets stuck in machine feed dogs and jams. My less expensive Brother LX3817 17 stitch full size sewing machine sews knit fabric like a dream! I'll keep using my sewing machine that works!
customer_reviews.author: nana of many

customer_reviews.title: Error E6 Code Unable to Clear Myself
customer_reviews.text: I called Brother and they told me that I would have to take it to one of their recommended Brother repair shops. If I take to someone to have fixed it will cost more than what I paid for the machine so I am junking it and buying a Janome MOD-19. I'm not a high user of a sewing machine so I was very disappointed and I am still disappointed that I am just junking this Brother machine!!! We are such a wasteful society...but the cost of items and services force us to do this :( !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the tension goes from perfect to all of a sudden way too loose when ...
customer_reviews.text: As if learning to sew isn't hard enough...the tension goes from perfect to all of a sudden way too loose when backstitching. I should I spent more on a sewing machine... Trying to making some Christmas gifts and I'm about to throw this thing out the window
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Tension Problems Will End Your Satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: I bought this several years ago and used it often. I used it often to make toddler quilts and loved the walking foot. I had no real problems with it until the past few months. Anytime that I needed to sew on double bias tape, I would have tension issues. I adjusted everything, cleaned the machine, re-threaded, and it would not solve the issue of bottom thread messes. There was so much that I liked about the machine, but the tension problems finally pushed me over the edge. I have just purchased a Janome 2212 and am happy with its replacement.
customer_reviews.author: SS in Montana

customer_reviews.title: Upon first using it I was delighted with its' ease of use and the quality of ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this machine for piecing and quilting. Upon first using it I was delighted with its' ease of use and the quality of results. However within sixty days after delivery it simply froze up. Handwheel won't turn and shows E6 when try to use. Followed all suggested fixes. Nothing changed. Amazon returns only accepted for first thirty days. Local repair centers charge almost as much as I paid for machine to service it. In the end, very disappointed and sorry I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: This machine was a big disappointment. Right from the start, it did not work a zig zag with the braiding foot recommended by Brother. After contacting Brother via email and phone, the problem was still not resolved. Following trouble shooting directions, replacing needle, type of thread, adjusting tension, rethreading, etc., did not fix the problem. Trying the zig zag stitch resulted in skipped stiches...a mess. After giving away my old machine to my daughter, I am regretfully returning this much over-hyped, super space age contraption. Brother email support was of no help whatsoever. The phone support was kindly, supportive, but ultimately ineffective. Perhaps, this machine was simply defective. I don't know. I'm returning it..
customer_reviews.author: LittleDove

customer_reviews.title: A machine I could thread easily. Joy!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't gone too far with this machine yet, but I jumped the first (and most daunting) hurdle for a sewing machine beginner - I threaded it - EASILY! I went on you tube and found an excellent video called "How to Set Up Brother CS6000I Sewing Machine" by Lin's Teahouse. It's short and sweet and she shows you exactly what to do. I think 'll be fine now and explore all the things this lightweight (plastic) machine can do. Been running test stitches on denim and learning as I'm doing. Seems user friendly and not intimidating. Will check out the manual soon. Happy sewing, people.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: 7 years later it’s still going strong. WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on Amazon in March 2011 and it’s the only sewing machine I’ve ever owned to date. It has been perfect for sewing quilts, dresses, project bags, pillowcases, etc. it does occasionally have a hard time feeding through/sewing through thick fabric, and as I’ve become more experienced and wanted to sew more complicated things I’ve wished I had a higher quality machine, but for the majority of things this is absolutely worth owning. I can’t remember any time I’ve had a major issue with it, and it’s light enough that I can pull it out when I need it without fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Easy and useful for many projects
customer_reviews.text: I have no sewing experience and decided to buy this based on the reviews. I'm so glad I did. This machine has many features, yet has been so easy for me as a beginner to use. I have been experimenting with different fabrics and projects, and have gotten to switch out the needles, the feet, and the threads. It's very easy to do and there are also video tutorials I found online that help with using the different features of this machine. I highly recommend this sewing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Good machine for the money
customer_reviews.text: It had been 30 years since I last sewed. This machine is different in many ways from what I used then. READ THE DIRECTIONS! If you go by "instinct" you'll run into trouble. It does so many things that once had to be done by hand. Yes, the tension is a little touchy, but if you play with it, you'll find the right level for your project. Mine is fussy about multiple layers of upholstery fabric (like the closing seam on a pillow), so I keep my old machine handy. But overall this a good machine for the money, and good to re-delvelop old skills while learning new ones.
customer_reviews.author: SueLib

customer_reviews.title: Auto Threader is Rubbish.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered, the Auto Threader didn't work, but since it was easy to operate, I ordered another with hopes that I'd just gotten a bad batch, big mistake. The 2nd Sewing Machine arrived with no outer box and the Brother Sewing Machine box was so damaged, I didn't even bother to open it up because I expected the machine to be damaged too. I sent the 2nd Brother back and I chose a Singer,it's pricier, but better made and easy to use, the Brother CS6000i is easy too, but it has too many problems with needles breaking, thread snapping, bobbin breakage, I just gave up with this machine. It's light, flimsy and cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: SY214Top Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: I HIGHLY  recommend this product for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS MACHINE! It came in the original box brand new with everything intact and in it. I've sewn some items already and I had no trouble. It doesn't come with the walking foot attached but I highly suggest begginers to attached it because it helps a lot with sewing in a straight line. Wished I knew the benefits of it it b4 I started because I had so much frustration at first lol. Never taking it off tho unless I need to. Now I'm having fun with it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sewing machine for a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great beginner sewing machine. It's smart enough to simplify threading a needle and easy to adjust stitch settings. It doesn't take long to get to know it. I've had it for nine years now and my brother and I bought one for our mom for Christmas last year. My only trouble has been with thread tension--occasionally it'll mess up (such that adjusting the dial doesn't really help) and the best solution is to take the bobbin out and rethread it. This may be user error, but I hope this suggestion helps someone else if they encounter the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine G.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first sewing machine. I never used one before and I must say I really love it. I never would have imagined I would make so many pretty things. I did not watch any videos before hand; the machine was easy to use , very simple and just awesome. The fast that it has an adjustable speed made it easy for me to " not be afraid " of it. The selection of stitches is amazing. I definitely recommend it. I attached some pictures with a cute kimono I made in 30 min and some of the awesome stitches you can do with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Joana

customer_reviews.title: Brothers’ Bobin Blues
customer_reviews.text: I like the easy threading. I have only been sewing for about 3 months. After 80 masks, snagging/bird nesting was occurring.. After buying a new needle, seemed to go away. At first I gave it a 4 because I can not compare it to a “well made” machine. I’m a big fan Of Brothers printers so I’ve stayed a loyal customer. I am now giving it a 5 stars for beginners like me. I found that if the top threading is different from bottom (bobbin) thread, will not catch properly. I am also pleased with the fancy stitching features. I’m at about 200 masks. Can’t wait to try out the button hole foot (included in box).
customer_reviews.author: EvAHa

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly new to sewing, but this machine has worked great!
customer_reviews.text: I have sewn some since I was a little girl, but I have had a hard time finding a machine that I like. I LOVE this machine. My mom and mother-in-law have been using Brother embroidery or embroider/sewing machines, and I've picked up how to use them on visits... so when I start looking for myself, this is what I settled on. I've done several sewing and quilting projects and it worked great. Little bit of a learning curve, but nothing that my impatient self couldn't have avoided with a little extra attention to detail. had the machine for almost a year with moderate use. No major issues, used it with foot petal and without petal. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Product
customer_reviews.text: This machine is impossible to use. Automatic threading DOES NOT WORK, difficult to thread, difficult to bring up the bobbin thread, does not go through anything more than very thin fabric, needles bend, thread jams. There is essentially one threading pattern with minor variations, but it is sold as having many stitches; they basically all come out the same. I took this to a local certified repair shop and was looked at with pity. Apparently, these are the machines used to train repair people and are then thrown out after each class; the product is that tacky. I can think of nothing good to say about this.
customer_reviews.author: nonegiven

customer_reviews.title: Good DIY machine.
customer_reviews.text: Good DIY sewing machine. If you want details look up Quilting and Sewing machine reviews on the web. Once you understand that each change requires you to reset other settings this thing will go through some fabric. Consider making a cheat sheet for settings that worked, each time you turn it off the settings reset.The bobbin is easy to change since it is a top loader.
customer_reviews.author: Dwarf15

customer_reviews.title: but am very pleased with the machine
customer_reviews.text: I am a newbie at sewing. I purchased with hesitancy due to my skill level, but am very pleased with the machine. You MUST READ the instruction manual and watch as many tutorial videos as possible. I am amazed at the accessories that are included. They will take a lifetime to learn how to use. This is a super easy machine to operate --- but it is complicated at the same time. You cannot expect the machine to do what you cannot do. Also, you should not abuse this machine. Most of its parts are plastic and I can see some parts (needle threader) breaking if you "force" anything. Works beautifully if you follow the correct steps. Happy sewing!
customer_reviews.author: Aladygreen

customer_reviews.title: This is a good sewing machine, just has a couple glaring issues.
customer_reviews.text: This sewing machine does well, it's a little tricky to properly load the bobbin and if it isn't loaded exactly then the machine drops stitches or doesn't work properly at all. My major gripe with the machine is the LCD display is set back in it's window and doesn't have a backlight. As a result to be able to see the codes in the window you practically have to shine a light in the window. The LCD is set back in the housing so any lighting overhead casts a shadow over the display making is hard if not impossible to read.
customer_reviews.author: Wizbang_FL

customer_reviews.title: Great tools make for good results!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been quilting since 1993, but I usually take my quilt tops out to be long arm quilted. I recently purchased this machine and have been watching you tube videos of people doing free motion quilting on home sewing machines. This machine is easy to use and comes with both a walking foot and a quilting foot. I started trying my hand at free motion quilting and find I like it much more than I thought I would. Having the right machine makes it so much more enjoyable, I recommend the Midnight Quilt Show with Angela Walters. Machine quilting is her favorite part and she inspires me.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Holmes

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this machine two years ago and still love it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this sewing machine after much research and much thought. I have sewn most of my life and my old Sewing machine (different brand) had always been a lemon and I had pretty much stopped sewing because I was tired of fighting it. This Brother machine was so easy to learn and it does anything I need it to and more. I love the ease of the drop in bobbin. This machine would be great for anyone from beginner on up. No regrets at this purchase, two years later I still love this machine!
customer_reviews.author: Mysteri

customer_reviews.title: Does pretty well, all considered
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this machine to learn to sew. Does pretty well, all considered,and it is quite intuitive for a noob at sewing like me. The friend who's teaching me tells me that it's a pretty decent machine as well. (She won't buy it, as she's very attached to her equipment.) Probably not good for pro work, but if you need to make clothes and you're not going pro, I'd say get this.
customer_reviews.author: D. Carr

customer_reviews.title: REALLY IT IS THIS GOOD!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second cs6000i I have used. The first I got second had over three years ago and I worked it hard over 40 hours a week on several different fabrics and thickness of materials. This is a great machine. From its speed controls to settings, push button power option and more this is the machine I will recommend every time! Do remember your machine is only as good as you take care of it. Always clean and change needles with ever project, using the needles that correspond with what you are sewing and you and this little work horse will have a long and happy sewing adventure together.
customer_reviews.author: LilyFlower

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for quilting, GREAT quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: As I got more serious about quilting and need a higher quality machine but was working with a serious budget, this looked like the best option and was a great choice. Sturdy Automatic needle threader is a huge time saver Bobbin is simple to wind LOVE the extendable table It doesn't have all the bells and whistles of a high end machine, but I don't have the money for a high end machine, and this has everything I need and then some. GREAT quality for the price
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS MACHINE!
customer_reviews.text: I am brand new to sewing. I destroyed one of the $30 kiddie machines in less than 24 hours. A friend of mine, recommended this machine. I watched a youtube video that one of the other reviewers of this product had done. It was as easy as she made it look! I was up and sewing within minutes. There are tons of resources for Brothers machines, including Facebook groups. I highly recommend this machine for new or advanced users. Thanks to all of those reviewed this product before me. You helped me choose the right sewing machine!
customer_reviews.author: MomPreneur

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the machine for a few months now. I have been amazed at all that it can do. It did make a scary clunking noise recently when using a certain stitch. But aside from that I have had no problems. The built in needle threading device works really well. It has easy to follow instructions for threading the machine. Overall the instruction manual is helpful. I didn't need to take any classes to begin sewing. And the price is ridiculously cheap for a product that does so much. I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Suz

customer_reviews.title: Incredible machine for the money
customer_reviews.text: It's simple, straightforward, lots of features, everything I need and more. And on top of that, it works beautifully. It's quiet and smooth, lightweight (less than half the weight of my old machine), with a well-lit sewing area. I LOVE the self-threading needle! Winding a bobbin is easy, threading the machine is easy, it has a foot pedal... I'm extremely pleased with it. I'm a rank amateur but not a complete beginner. SO happy with this, I'm glad I replaced my (very) old straight-stitch-only machine.
customer_reviews.author: nansaidh

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginner or long time user!
customer_reviews.text: This sewing machine is the absolute bomb!!!! It is easy to use, the booklet helps a lot for a first time user like me, it's lightweight yet gets bigger jobs done. I sewed straps on my bed because my sheets were coming up and it was driving me nuts and now my sheets stay taut even after sleeping all night and a toddler jumping on it in the morning. The price point is pretty great considering these machines go into the thousands. I definitely recommend for a beginner or a long time user!
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Great little lightweight machine
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this machine twice...once for friends and once for my daughter, however, my daughter's machine is the one I am using for a Tuesday quilting group I belong to.Maybe I should order my own...tee hee! I have several other machines but this one is perfect for taking to classes. Easy to use..Very light weight...Perfect for beginners, too. My bigger machines are Baby Locks so the threading, is the same for Brother machines. It's true that the light isn't very bright but that is easily solvable. Plus, it is so light weight that it sometimes jiggles when sewing heavier fabrics. Putting it on a placemat helps a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily.
customer_reviews.text: While sewing some medium weight canvas curtains, the needle jammed during use and the machine no longer works. It was only the 4th time the machine had been used it was too late to return it. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Mrgrita

customer_reviews.title: A good machine but some attachments missing.
customer_reviews.text: This sewing machine works well and appears new but the box appeared to have been opened, then taped back, which is acceptable to me except that some attachments were missing, including the walking foot, quilting foot and quilting guide. This is sold as a quilting sewing machine but those specific accessories are what makes it so. Because this machine was replacing an older machine of the same brand, I still had those attachments which were missing. Otherwise I would have returned the machine. I love the Brother sewing machines, you just can’t drop them like I did my old machine! So the 3 Stars are for the machine, a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: NS

customer_reviews.title: 9 month old and won't work...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Brother CS6000i Computer sewing matching (06/11/2018). It has stopped working, locks up (E6 error). I have looked on YouTube for a fix, doesn’t work. I cleaned and oiled said machine, still locking up. I had a Sears Kenmore for over 50 years, still worked great, never had a problem with it, I replaced it with this machine to update...BIG MISTAKE...I want Amazon to replace this matching with an upgrade with the same features and support the machine is in working condition or give me my money back. I’m not accepting this. I expect a persona; phone call or email or provide me a hone line to the customer to discuss this matter. Gwen M Casteel
customer_reviews.author: Gwen M Casteel

customer_reviews.title: A great machine
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner and I love this machine. I had a singer machine (that I loved!) before this and in my learning I managed to jam it beyond repair. So I ordered this one and the top loading bobbin is a lifesaver. The bobbin winder loads the bobbin so evenly. Because it is computerized, it “freezes” if the material is too thick or if something isn’t right. At first I found that frustrating, but once I realized that it was saving me from damaging ANOTHER machine, I was grateful. The speed adjuster is so helpful and once you get the hang of the automatic threader, it’s great too. I have no complaints about this machine so far.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: This one fits the bill and I have loved using it to make quilts
customer_reviews.text: I am a bi-lateral above the knee amputee so having a sewing machine that I am able to operate using only my hands is very important to me. This one fits the bill and I have loved using it to make quilts, clothes for my grandsons and not only making outfits for my granddaughter but making a matching outfit for her American Girl dolls. Have sewn curtains for my kitchen, matching hand towels and pot holders, table runners, place mats and bedding for my service dog as well as sewing his vests/capes that identify him as a service dog. This is a great machine for someone who can not use their feet to operate the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Lake

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: I am an absolute beginner when it comes to sewing, so I did a little research and turns out this sewing machine is what was recommended for beginners. I love it! It's very easy to use, and light.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Nice sewing machine.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first sewing machine. I had to watch some video's online along with reading the instructions. I wasn't sure I was going to figure out how to use it, but with the video's I was able to figure out what the instructions were talking about and within a day I was sewing! I don't have any other experience to compare it to, but I love the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Calderhead

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love it...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this machine. Setup was quick and easy, lots of options and I loved the variable speed control. The issue was no matter how much I adjusted the tension, changed needles, etc. I couldn't get a tight stitch. I am assuming something was wrong with the machine I recieved but I wasn't comfortable buying another one after having the issue with a new on. I ended up buying a Singer 4432 and love the simplicity of it being mechanical as opposed to computerized. I just feel there is less to go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Osborne

customer_reviews.title: it's a good machine.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 6 year old granddaughter because of the hand control and speed control. I bought one for myself for my Florida apartment and am now ordereing another one to travel with. It's lightweight and small enough to fit under the seat in a plane. The only complaint - AND IT IS A BIG ONE -- is that the default needle position is on the left. Never heard of such a thing! I've broken too many needles because I forgot to set the needle position to 01 instead of the default 00. What is the purpose of this? I also had to buy a 1/4" foot. Otherwise, it's a good machine.
customer_reviews.author: Rayna Gillman

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine in February, 2020. It is now August, 2020, and the machine is broke. The tension has been off for a while, and now the feed dogs are messing up. When I sew, the feed dogs don't come up far enough to move the fabric. Other times I am sewing and they will suddenly shift to the left. Then I get an E6 error message. I struggled and fought with it for a month. Finally went out and bought a Babylock. Sewing is suppose to be stress free!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is one fantastic sewing machine.  Easy to learn and use.
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't used a sewing machine in over 15 years. I remember back in 1964 when I lived in Taiwan some friends of mine owned a little sewing shop and Brother was their sewing machine choice. Their work was gorgeous. Now I own a Brother and personally know why my friends loved the Brother machines. I had to go slow to learn; but the machine was on my side. The instructions were clear and the machine was cooperative. It would be hard to make a mistake. So far, no problems. I look forward to long and happy years of smooth sewing.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia V. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: I do not like the needle threader
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the needle threader, and maybe I just need to work with it more, but other than that I was very impressed with the machine and all it can do for the price. I bought this for my daughter-in-law and think she will be well pleased with it. I very much like the fact that you can slow it down for the less experienced sewer or for tricky curves or sew medium speed or fast. I like the variety of stitches it offers and all the different feet that comes with it. I would definately buy it again
customer_reviews.author: MEW

customer_reviews.title: So far so good with this machine
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner. So far so good with this machine. I've had machines before that just left me frustrated, and I gave up, threw it in the closet and then sold it in a garage sale years later. This machine has the drop in bobbin..SO MUCH easier. I've sewn a few pillow cases, some curtains, a few shirts, and hemmed a ton of jeans. It is light and easy to move around. It's very easy to understand and operate. I am enjoying it!
customer_reviews.author: Rhy

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I honestly only ordered this because I need to take my brother Pe300s in for repair and I have too many projects to be without a machine. Read over the manual and started using it. I’m extremely impressed. I quilt thick layers often and it handles them like a pro! It’s a very very good machine, especially for the money. I haven’t taken my other machine in for repair and if it wasn’t for the embroidery part of that one I would probably not even get fixed because I’m so pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get this machine. I had trouble;e with it from the beginning. It stopped working 2 moths after buying iy. I took it to the repair shop and they said the gears were shot and it would be more to fix it than it was worth. I called Brother and they said that they couldn't do anything about it unless I took it to one of their repair shops. Closest one to me is over an hour away. Its not worth it. I will look for another brand. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: jnnfrcm88

customer_reviews.title: Love this sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: Love this sewing machine! Easy to use, it's almost idiot proof. I'm so glad I bought it. Very light to take to our ladies quilt get together. Runs smoothly, love needle threader. So many wonderful stitches. I would gladly recommend this sewing machine to anyone who wants or likes to sew. Also the seller was quick. I ordered it one day, and next day had it! Talk about wow! Mine also came with a walking foot, free motion foot, and a hard cover. I was extremely delighted.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne

customer_reviews.title: Easy and affordable beginner friendly machine!
customer_reviews.text: Before I received this machine, I had never sewn before. I wanted to learn to quilt, but I was intimidated by all the sewing machine options out there. I finished piecing my first patchwork block after having this machine for only 3 days! The manual is very helpful, and because this is such a popular model, there are countless video tutorials available online for anything you don’t know how to do. You also can’t beat the fact that this machine comes with so many different feet for different projects so you can hit the ground running. I’m very happy with my choice and I would recommend this to other newbie sewers and quilters!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Brenskelle

customer_reviews.title: Suits my every need and then some and is very fun to use!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this little machine. I haven't sewed in many years and this little lightweight machine suits my every need, sews like a charm and is very fun to use. I especially like the auto-needle threader (it takes a little finesse to learn how to use it but it is a marvelous time-saving tool). And I really love that I can use a double needle with this machine for hemming knits. Can't say enough about how happy I am that I bought this. And you can find all the instruction "How To's" you need on You Tube, that take you through each page of the owner's manual, then you will be all set for everything.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Lucas

customer_reviews.title: At its price, you can’t go wrong with the CS6000i sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend the Brother CS6000i sewing machine and think it represents excellent value for money. It’s not a workhorse and certainly isn’t a heavy duty machine, but it’s pretty much perfect for the beginner sewer or for someone just using it for everyday projects (with some quilting on the side!). As well as being reasonably priced, it’s easy to use and comes with a host of interesting accessories. If you want to practise your sewing skills or venture into some more ambitious projects, the Brother CS6000i is the sewing machine for you.
customer_reviews.author: Danny William Yu Woo

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little machine!! I had one like it before and lost it to a a house fire-so sad!! For $150 this is so much machine! It is all electronic, has so many different pressed foot options, stitch options, thread cutter, the whole nine yards. It's not super heavy duty if you want it to sew denim or other thick materials but for hobby sewing, some quilting, etc it is wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: E. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Sewing Machine
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Christmas gift for my mom. I have to say it is quieter than her last 15 year old machine haha! But is just better overall, she doesn't fully use all the features (yet) but either way fantastic little gift and piece of hardware. Definitely recommend to anyone that loves to sew and create their own, well anything 😁!
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: LOOVE IT (cs7000i)
customer_reviews.text: *BROTHER CS7000i* Had it for about a week now, it came quickly, with everything pictured. Absolutely love my machine! It’s a big change from my old BrotherXR3774. It’s super quiet, simple to use, and I’m already well adjusted to it. I love the speed settings and LOVEEE the start/stop, reverse, and needle position buttons. So far I adore my machine and I’m so happy with it!!! Will update every other month
customer_reviews.author: Aaliyah Nicole

customer_reviews.title: It's just ok
customer_reviews.text: I waited to write a review on this machine until I used it for a few months. I love the selection of stitches it gives you. However, I have issues with the machine bunching up the material. I have become very close with my seam ripper using this machine. Also the package was missing the screw driver. Luckily my husband had an extra one in his tool arsenal, so I didn't contact the seller about this. When I wanted to replace a needle, one of the needles that came with the machine was bent. I know this machine is mostly for beginners, however I will be looking for a more advanced one. I don't think it will be a Brother.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. As a beginner, I have already made a pillow and lounge pants with this machine. I chose this model bc it was highly recommended on Amazon and also has many how-to videos on YouTube. I learn much easier from videos than reading the manual. Easy set up. Go ahead and purchase an extra pack of plastic bobbins with this. I wasn't able to find the brother brand (SA156) in Joann's. I use guterman thread and it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley T

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I like the extended table and I like the Accessories. I did not like how impossible it is to use the SCREW disc ....there is no room for the hand as you try to remove the presser foot holder. I wanted to work with THE FREE MOTION QUILTING and although I checked demos this wasn't working for me/ I did like that there is NO light in the OPERATION PANEL - I had to use a flesh light to check my setting. I couldn't find any HELP on BROTHER's site. No HOW TO video from BROTHER. I use the machine for small projects (i.c.Tot bags). For the above reasons I am returning the sawing machine.
customer_reviews.author: lizbiz

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have had this machine for about a week and a half. So far I love it. Have not had an issue. Definitely feel like I got my money's worth. Prior to this is had a Brother lx 3125, but that was a bit on the heavier side and I hated lugging it around. This one is a bit lighter and had so many accessories that I didnt hesitate to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SFlo

customer_reviews.title: don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Hate it! Have a brother SE400 I love it but feed dogs broke after a year, but it still embroiders. I bought this piece of crap based on reviews and price. It is crap! Stitches uneven and no playing with tension helps. It does not give you any warning that the bobbin is empty or will be soon. My other one lets me know. bobbin doesn't wind very smooth so end up winding 2 for each job bc it will stop due to poorly wound bobbin once get part way through it. I am so surprised it has such great reviews!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine for taking to sew days and even for general use at home. While I have not tried to sew very heavy items such as jeans or drapes, it works beautifully on other standard weight materials. I got it mainly for the needle threader and for the needle up or down stop option. This is the 3rd Brother machine I have and is wonderful. I would definitely recommend this choice to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: keyrat596

customer_reviews.title: It’s a work horse!
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. I sew everything from vinyl and upholstery fabric to lightweight cotton. It’s a work horse, lightweight, and easy to use. Clean stitches every time. I’ve used heavy duty, upholstery, and regular threads. I sew handbags and It rarely jams. Both times mine has it was because I had forgotten to move the starting thread tails out of the way. This was my first Brother machine after a lifetime of Singers and Kenmores. I will always buy Brother now.
customer_reviews.author: LadyO

customer_reviews.title: My wife like this machine more than her $4000 Elna.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, this is just nuts. I got this as a throw down machine to supplement my wife's Elna 740 Excellence quilting machine, a $4000 machine. She says she likes this Brother machine a bit more than the Elna. I got the 1/4 inch piecing foot based on other people's reviews. She is very happy with this little "throw down" machine. Why did I spend $4000 on an Elna when this little guy makes her smile? Something to consider when looking.
customer_reviews.author: John Treble

customer_reviews.title: this is a horrible machine
customer_reviews.text: Terrible machine. Its supposed to be new buf irs giving me problems my 2 year okd sewing machine gives me. It sucks fabric is and tangles thread on all tensions. It constantlt ia creating 3 strings when its time for me to cut the string when sewing and i have to rjp it out... Bunches uo the strings on simple lines of thin cotton fabric. It jammed like it was fully broken. Its a horrible machine. Im pretty upset by the amount i payed for it. It doesnt seem new at all. The machine part is acting old, likes its been refurbished. And thats not what i payed for
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sewing machine for beginners and advanced
customer_reviews.text: I have been making little things with this sewing machine before I put my review just to make sure that it worked properly... and it does! Last of my creations was an amazing dress that my husband couldn't believe I made it myself! The instructions are very clear and it even has a quick start guide to have you started straight away. I still need to take a look to all the ways you can sew, but so far I have been trying the first row of sewing styles and it makes a great job. My mum is a professional sewer and she said that it is brilliant and the price is unbeatable! I would recommend this machine 100%
customer_reviews.author: Noelia G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner's Machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine to learn to quilt. It's important to read the book, watch a couple tutorials if you need more, use Brother parts, and it sews beautifully. Light enough to carry to classes which I have done a few. Made some small projects including a throw and just finished my second small quilt, an I-Spy for my grandson. This machine can't be beat for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Quilting Grandmom

customer_reviews.title: Everyone I quilt with have these super expensive do everything machines that run into the 10s ...
customer_reviews.text: Mine broke after 4 years from over use as I am a quilter. It broke while I was on a retreat. Came right home and bought the same one again. Everyone I quilt with have these super expensive do everything machines that run into the 10s of thousands of dollars. I had this and loved it. Had even more stiches than I would ever need as I basically sew forward and backward and maybe once in a while zigzag. I figured why learn a whole new machine when I loved what I had so I bought it again. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: toughteach

customer_reviews.title: I thought I hated sewing. Turns out I just hated my old machine.
customer_reviews.text: I was gifted this machine for use in some home projects. I thought I didn't like sewing but it turns out that what I didn't like was my old machine. This Brother machine has been so easy to use and to re-learn on. Once you figure out tension you are on your way. There was a very helpful review about setting the needle to stop in the "up" position. I would wholeheartedly agree with that review. Directions on how to do that are buried in the instructor manual but if you look at the back of the instructions you will find an index and you can look it up there.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. My girls brought it to sewing class and their teacher ended up buying several because she loved the speed control that her fancy Berninas did not have. These are great for our needs- pillows, Halloween costumes, hemming and small projects here and there. My 8 year old knows it better than I do and is the one I call if I have a question.
customer_reviews.author: mw

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine because of its features and the price. The deal seemed too good to be true, and turns out that was the case after all. It worked for just over a year, jammed up, and the dealer couldn't fix it. I thought it was just me/a fluke, so I bought another, and it did the SAME thing. So if you only need a machine for a year, go for it. Otherwise, don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: L. Price

customer_reviews.title: Sewing Teacher Review
customer_reviews.text: I teach sewing classes to Junior high and high school students. Three years ago, I bought 23 of these for my students. These machines are durable, easy to use, and..... childproof!!! We have yet to break one. Our older model-janome-workhorse-completely-metal machines broke constantly, and cost an arm and a leg to fix. My students love this machine too. At least eight have purchased the same machine for home use after loving them at school. I'm very happy with this machine!!
customer_reviews.author: Taryn Bland

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: I liked this machine. However, after 2 years it locked up. This machine has ungreased bushings, not bearings. It is metal on metal. Repair shop wanted to charge $200.00 to fix and said it wasn't worth fixing. My son fixed the problem but now can't get timing set right. This machine is cheaply made and meant to be disposable according to the repairman. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: val

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice!
customer_reviews.text: I've not had a chance to use this machine much ... I purchased this to replace my Singer that finally 'gave up' after years of use. Mainly wanted a machine to to mending and alterations since I no longer make my clothes - but do occasionally tackle bedspreads or drapes. SO ... I decided I'd get a machine with a few more 'bells and whistles' - as well as the basics. This machine set up easy and so far the little iIve used it for has been great! Looks like after MUCH research, I did make a good choice ... more later!
customer_reviews.author: dm

customer_reviews.title: Anyone can sew with this machine!
customer_reviews.text: Best beginner sewing machine! I thought I was a terrible sewer, turns out I had an awful machine. I am a great sewer with this machine. It's so easy to use. There are lots of stitch options and each one tells you which foot to use. It is very easy to thread. Love the drop in bobbin feature. Everything you could need comes included with this machine. You don't need to buy anything else except thread and some bobbins. The manual also explains all the different stitches. If that's not easy enough, this is a very popular machine, I was able to find video tutorials easily on youtube. I've recommended this machine to everyone. You will love it!
customer_reviews.author: Estelle

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good machine that if used with the right combination of ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good machine that if used with the right combination of needles and thread you can sew up to light weight leather with it. Out of the box it has performed very will with sewing 8 oz denim as well as leather materials. Read the owners manual it is very explanatory on how this machine functions as well as what it is capable of.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Walma

customer_reviews.title: Best sewing machine!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Christmas present for my daughter. Needless to say, now I'm jealous! This little baby packs quite a punch, and sews so beautifully! Will probably be purchasing one for myself. The machine came with quite a few feet, and WOW - the stiches! Very easy to use, and so lightweight!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not a good sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sewing machine for my mother in July, 2018. It was apparent by the end of August that it was defective or poorly designed. Amazon won't take it back and the authorized service center said it just needs "cleaning" for $149.99 which is a few cents more than the sewing machine costs. We cleaned it ourselves by manufacturer instructions (how dirty could it get in a few weeks?) and it still doesn't work. Do not purchase this machine!
customer_reviews.author: BETH SUGGS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: Love this sewing machine. I have never used a sewing machine a day in my life. I bought it to make a quilt. I have only made face masks, hemmed shorts so far. I cannot wait to actually do my quilting project. The drop in bobbin is a blessing. I would recommend getting extra bobbins. It comes with a few. It does come with a lot of other accessories. I cannot day enough about this machine. I am so impressed with all I have been able to do. It has been very easy to use. There are tons of YouTube videos to find guidance. So, do not hesitate buying this machine, you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Lanham

customer_reviews.title: Movin' on up!  Done with the old cast-iron machine.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my spouse, who doesn't often like "newfangled." She is quite pleased with this and easily did a couple of projects right off! SUGGESTION: Go on YouTube and search for this model number. There are some very helpful videos that show clearly what they attempt to describe in the instructions. This was especially helpful with threading and the reverse feature.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Scott

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, no skipped stitches, works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I was using the Brother HC1800 but have had problems with tension, skipping stitches, bobbin since day one but I managed to make it last about a year or so. I need a lightweight machine to take to classes and use when not making use of the heavier Brother machine. For this first week of use it is fantastic. Easy to learn, sews like a dream, no skipped stitches, straight and zigzag work excellent. For the price this is a quality machine.
customer_reviews.author: acferran

customer_reviews.title: A solid buy...
customer_reviews.text: Needed a sewing machine so I could make masks for my family and friends during the pandemic. I used to sew when I was a child. This machine Is pretty easy to use and when I had a problem I could find the solution on YouTube. Love that it has a drop in bobbin. For the price I can’t really complain much. Only issue I’ve had so far is my thread bunching where I backstich which I think I can fix by using scrap fabric in front of it. I’d recommend for anyone wanting to sew!
customer_reviews.author: Meaghan J

customer_reviews.title: ... machine approximently 5 years ago and it works as good as the day I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine approximently 5 years ago and it works as good as the day I bought it. Mostly I do craft projects on it, for example I plan to help my daughter make curtains next month. I love it. Not only does it sew well but it is light weight and I can carry it easily even after having a broken shoulder. It also stores well in my closet when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does big come with all 10 pieces claimed
customer_reviews.text: I love my Brother sewing machine. I didn't realize I was missing pieces (namely 3 feet that the description claims to come with this model), not did I receive the screwdriver for replacing the needle. Or the other pieces that have always come with previous Brother machines. This is my 4th Brother machine.
customer_reviews.author: Allison B Rose

customer_reviews.title: My how machines have changed...
customer_reviews.text: I still have my heavy Kenmore from 1972 which is a workhorse that will last forever. But, it's not portable so I purchase this machine. Easily carried in one hand. Instructions are mostly clear. The lever to lower the presser foot seems to be in an awkward location for me. Lots more options than my old Kenmore, but it will not likely still be functioning 40+ years from now. Broke a needle early on and I don't know why. Purchased the recommended brand name bobbins, so I'm not sure if generic works well. Overall, I am very happy though; it is portable, tension is easily adjusted, and it is relatively easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS SEWING MACHINE.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS SEWING MACHINE. It works so great and makes me feel more confident to tackle projects. I love all the feet that it comes with and just really am very happy that I bought this for myself. It works so much better than the cheapy I used for years and was forever adjusting tensions and fiddling with settings to keep it from making a mess. This machine is terrific.
customer_reviews.author: Jess from Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the technologically challenged.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my wife who is re-learning to sew. She is not very technology or mechanically friendly and has been through a bunch of sewing machines and always gives up when she gets frustrated with setting up or operating the machine. Since getting this one, she is actually sewing again! She figured out how to operate this one in a single day and has been having fun sewing ever since. Great machine and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kaos

customer_reviews.title: Not to last for years.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this sewing machine on August 2015 and have used it 10 times tops. A couple of weeks ago I turn it on to sew something and the presser foot is stuck. Don't know much about these machines but for me less than 10 uses is not good.
customer_reviews.author: Mika

customer_reviews.title: Very usable sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: This model was recommended by a friend as being a good all around sewing machine that had the capacity to do a good deal of quilting work (it does not come with a 1/4" foot, but they are sold on Amazon too). It does come with many feet, including others helpful to quilting. This machine is so easy to use!! I don't use the needle threader option, although others may like that feature. My old sewing machine necessitated much more work with bobbin winding and stitch and stitch count changes. Brother has a nice broadly usable machine in this model. It is very light and comes with a cover and long arm also.
customer_reviews.author: Rural ID.nurseTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: This is a Great Sewing Machine!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the easiest machines I have ever sewn on. It's light weight makes it very portable. I am pleased that it came with a cover, however I will buy an actual case to carry it in. I have sewn on MUCH more expensive, fancier machines. This one is perfect for the sewing I am doing now. The stitches are even and accurate no matter which stitch pattern is chosen.
customer_reviews.author: cops mom

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This sewing machine has seized on me twice. The first time it happened I did call Brother and they did send me to a local sewing center it took over a week but it ran well for a couple of months then it seized on me again. I did call Brother but since it is over a year since I purchased the machine was no longer under warranty. I am a novice at sewing, I only use a straight stitch and I may have 80 hours of use on this machine. I will not buy another Brother sewing machine.
customer_reviews.author: peggy hebert

customer_reviews.title: GREAT machine! Love how durable and quiet it is! You won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this machine! I have several other Brother sewing/embroidering machines but wanted one dedicated to quilting without being over the top. This is a great machine for beginners or internediate sewists. Love the extension table and how quiet the machine runs, even at high speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I've only just been dabbling in simple sewing currently, but it works great! my only complaint is the speed as it seems to not gradually increase or decrease depending on the pressure on the foot. It feels very much like there are only the set speeds and that's all. There are a lot fo parts i have yet to mess with and am quite intimidated by, but im really looking forward to learning. The manual also has a lot of instructions and is very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Alana

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and convenient to travel with.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice lightweight sewing machine which I purchased to travel to classes, meetings and workshops. The price is great and it includes a large sewing surface. For the life of me, however, I don't understand how it can be called a "quilting" machine and not include a quarter inch quilting foot. I needed to buy one the first week after purchasing the machine. It also has small throat space - OK for me because I have a large, heavy quilting machine for home use. But, it will be difficult to do actual machine quilting on this machine except very small projects. So far, it's great for travel.
customer_reviews.author: S. S.

customer_reviews.title: Brother cs6000i computerized sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! This is a very easy machine to set up and use. I just got it and it works well with the straight stitch, zigzag stitch, quilting walking foot and quilting free motion adapter. The price is very affordable and includes many attachments for a variety of sewing options. I am sure I will have many hours of enjoyment with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Reilly

customer_reviews.title: So-So
customer_reviews.text: This machine is great for occasional and light sewing. The worst thing about this machine is small distance between the machine and the sewing platform 2 1/2 inches. It is really cramped. Also, on the left the machine is it is 2 1/2 inches, which leaves the needle with little clearance.
customer_reviews.author: nannk

customer_reviews.title: I keep breaking these.  Then I buy another because I wouldn't have anything else.
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased my third one of these; not because it's not sturdy, but because I accidentally knocked the previous two off my sewing table onto a hard floor. No machine survives that (the floor was a mess, too). But when considering what to replace the broken ones with, I kept coming back to this machine because it's easy to use, does exactly what I want it to, has just enough bells and whistles to make it fun, isn't horribly expensive, and if I would just stop waving foam mattresses and large boxes around, I'm pretty sure it would last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Stormvoël

customer_reviews.title: WOW this is the perfect machine for everyday sewing
customer_reviews.text: WOW this is the perfect machine for everyday sewing. I purchased it for the grandkids because the cheap kid machine was a nightmare for them. This thing is cheap but nothing about its quality is cheap. I LOVE IT!!!! Perfect for normal sewing task and not bulky or difficult to manage. If you want a simple reliable machine this thing is it! I just can't figure out the automatic threader but it will come to me eventually...lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get more machine for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This model beats Singer Heavy Duty 4423 model. The operation is very smooth. There's instructions on the machine and it actually comes with an easy to reference manual. You can also get a pdf manual if you want. I can't believe so many accessories come with this machine. Brother is really looking out for there customers. The only thing I don't like is the case. This case is useless because it doesn't lock and with the big opening dust will eventually get in.
customer_reviews.author: D Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Last
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this 6000i machine so much. I sewed clothes and crafts and quilts. After two years and one month -- BOOM. The whole thing locked up and is now useless. I only paid $137 for it. The repair would have been well over that amount. I want another one just like it but I'm afraid the same thing will happen. Now the price has gone up to about $400. Warranty was only for one year. EDIT: I took it to another Brother Authorized Repair Dealer. He told me the normal life expectancy of this machine is about two years. I bought a new machine instead of having the repair. This time I bought a VERY good one!
customer_reviews.author: Jacquie

customer_reviews.title: Such an awesome machine
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 30-year-old male who has never touched a sewing machine before. I really wanted to taper in the legs on my jeans...so I bought this machine and went for it. I'm genuinely surprised by the quality of this product. I have had it for a while now, and it always just works. Changing the feet is easy, and it's a relatively forgiving machine. I would absolutely recommends for beginners, and for those with experience using sewing machines.
customer_reviews.author: spd

customer_reviews.title: Great starter and advanced sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: This is our first brand new sewing machine we really like it has a lot of nice features. We did a lot of research and try to stay within our budget, we considered many of the larger brands that are more expensive but we always stuck with the Japanese brand. the nice thing about this machine is the wide variety of attachments and accessories that it comes with as well as the foot pedal this makes it great for a starter in the sewing or an advanced sewer or quilter. We considered Brother, Baby Lock, Janome, and Juki sewing machines, if and when we do by the next machine it will probably be either a Juki or a Baby Lock.
customer_reviews.author: Indiana DIY

customer_reviews.title: It is a great machine, the first project i did with it ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this machine for a few months. It is a great machine, the first project i did with it is quilt a queen sized quilt. It handled it like a champ! I did not like that it has such a small neck but i did manage to get it thru. I have done upholstery including making cording (bought the foot for cording separate ) and have had no problems.I love that it is light weight. I have never broke a needle or been frustrated with breaking thread all the time .
customer_reviews.author: suzanne northup

customer_reviews.title: Breaks down often
customer_reviews.text: I have had this machine for 18 months. It is easy to use and I really like it when it is working. I have gotten an E6 message twice. First time it was under warranty and now it isn't. The manual will tell you that thread is tangles up inside somewhere. Not true. From what I see online, this is a common problem. There is a bushing that locks up behind the computer board that can't be oiled without taking it apart. To get it repaired again would probably cost almost as much as the machine. Poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Vgrabo

product_meta.title: Brother Sewing and Quilting Machine, CS6000i, 60 Built-in Stitches, 2.0" LCD Display, Wide Table, 9 Included Sewing Feet
product_meta.description: Style Name:CS6000iThis user-friendly and portable sewing and quilting machine offers a wide range of quilting and sewing features at an affordable price. The CS6000i features 60 built-in sewing stitches, including decorative stitches and 7 styles of one-step buttonholes. There are 9 presser feet included in this machine - buttonhole, overcasting, monogramming, zipper, zigzag, blindstich, button fitting, walking, and spring action quilting foot. This machine also includes a detachable wide table that is perfect for larger quilting projects. The Brother CS6000i sewing machine has been engineered for ease of use. A simple-to-view backlit LCD display, an automatic needle threader, easy-to-follow threading diagrams, and an adjustable sewing speed control system are all included. An easy-to-see, brightly lit sewing area is quite helpful when sewing on dark fabrics. An automatic needle threader has been added to perfectly align thread through the needle. A built-in free arm helps to assist with sewing pant legs, sleeves, and other cylindrical items. The CS6000i sewing machine also includes a hard machine case, making it a perfect traveling sewing machine. The CS6000i sewing and quilting machine includes a printed Quick Start guide and complete instructions manuals in English and Spanish. We do not recommend using this machine in countries that do not support 120V AC, even if a voltage adapter is in use. This sewing and quilting machine includes a bilingual user manual, a 25-year limited , and free customer phone and online technical support for the life of the product.
